assign.name: Assignment #5 (Stage 1 Submission)
assign.intro:
The document containing the questions for the assignment is not here.  This is just where you will do your Stage 1 submission.

Note the following marking policies which apply to all of the Assignments:

  • On assignments where vector quantities are used, one mark on each question involving vectors is for consistently correct use of vector symbols throughout your solution.  Each assignment will indicate (in the assignment document) whether the assignment involves any vector quantities.
  • On each question which has a numerical answer, one mark is for carrying out an explicit unit check.
  • Every assignment starts with a "Getting a Feel" part.  This part of the assignment will get you to make some rough estimates.  This is partly to get you to practise order of magnitude estimation.  But, it is also so that you will develop an idea of what "big" and "small" mean in different contexts.
  • There are never marks for the final numerical answers (on questions which have numerical answers).  However, there are marks for "assessing your answers".  This means checking/justifying that your answer is reasonable.  In most cases this will involve comparing your  answer to something.  The Getting a Feel questions will provide you with things to compare assignment answers with.  Sometimes you may have to look back at previous assignments to find something suitable to compare with.
  • On the early assignments you will be reminded to assess your answers and you may even be given hints about how to assess them.  As the course goes on you will be given less and less guidance on assessing as you develop your skill.  You should eventually be in the habit of assessing your answers so that no reminders will be necessary.
  • Work symbolically a much as you can.  Any solution which is just a "wall of numbers" will not be marked and will receive a mark of zero.
